content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --RFTDTC
      operator: exists
    - name: --TPTREF
      operator: not_exists
Core:
  Id: CORE-000165
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when --TPTREF is not present in dataset when --RFTDTC
  is present.
Outcome:
  Message: --TPTREF is not present when --RFTDTC is present in a dataset
  Output Variables:
    - --RFTDTC
    - --TPTREF
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0090
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: '"The actual date or date and time of a time point
                  that acts as a fixed reference for a series of planned time points,
                  represented in a standardized character format. The fixed reference
                  point is in --TPTREF"'
                Document: Model v2.0
                Section: Timing
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0090
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: '"Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF."'
                Document: Model v1.7
                Section: 2.2.5 Timing Variables for All Classes
                Item: Table 2.2.5.1 --RFTDTC 
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.2'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0090
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: '"(--RFTDTC) Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF in ISO 8601 character format."'
                Document: Model v1.4
                Section: 2.2.5 Timing Variables for All Classes
                Item: Specification 
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Raise an error when --TPTREF is not present in dataset when --RFTDTC is present.

Outcome.Message: --TPTREF is not present when --RFTDTC is present in a dataset

Citations.Cited_Guidance: "The actual date or date and time of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for a series of planned time points, represented in a standardized character format. The fixed reference point is in --TPTREF"
"Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF."
"(--RFTDTC) Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF in ISO 8601 character format."
